column5: I wasn't planning on going out this morning with the forecast saying rain and wind all day, but when I got up I checked the forecast again.  It said high winds later in the day and the showers that were happening would end around 10.  So I headed out for 10, and was pleasantly surprised to see the waters up a bit, with about two feet of visibility.  I was rewarded today!!  First I set the hook and felt a small fish on.  It fought like a little champ and I was surprised to see this gorgeous brown!!  Love the colours and markings on this one!   Let that little guy go and began drifting a nice seam along a drop off.  Float goes down again and I hook into this nice steelie!   Back to the creek it went to get bigger!  The winds began to pick up so I packed it in and headed home for lunch.
Nice looking fish and good on you for getting out.
Nice morning, I'd spend an hour for those any day
Nice Cliff. You weekday guys kill me. LOL  Ok,these were on the pin?
Thanks guys!!  Brian....the centerpin you sold me is still in the box. Lol
Thanks guys!!  Brian....the centerpin you sold me is still in the box. Lol   Those are the perfect starter size Cliff.Thats how I started. Now get that reel out and get started.
Brian....I may just do that.  Need to spoil it the other way I think as i am right hand retrieve.  Now....how the heck do you cast the thing?? Lol
